experience_assessment: I have published in this field for several years.
review_assessment:_thoroughness_in_paper: I made a quick assessment of this paper.
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I did not assess the experiments.
title: Official Blind Review #3
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I did not assess the derivations or theory.
review:
I have checked the paper that AnonReviewer1 pointed out and verified that the two papers are identical. It would be better to reject the paper. 

I would also appreciate authors to consider the comments from the previous ICLR-19 reviews and improve the paper. 

I also think that the desk rejection would be an appropriate decision for this paper. 

At least it would be good to add the following papers as pointed by one of review last year.
- Pham, T., Tran, T., Phung, D., & Venkatesh, S. (2016, April). DeepCare: A deep dynamic memory model for predictive medicine. In Pacific-Asia Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (pp. 30-41). Springer, Cham.
- Koutnik, J., Greff, K., Gomez, F., & Schmidhuber, J. (2014). A clockwork RNN. arXiv preprint arXiv:1402.3511.
- Chen, C., Kim, S., Bui, H., Rossi, R., Koh, E., Kveton, B., & Bunescu, R. (2018, October). Predictive Analysis by Leveraging Temporal User Behavior and User Embeddings. In Proceedings of the 27th ACM International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (pp. 2175-2182). ACM.
